title: CBC Radio
text:
Finding affordable housing in Canada is becoming increasingly difficult.

Nearly two million people in the country are in housing that is unsafe, overcrowded, or unaffordable. And with Canadians heading to the polls this month, housing is one of the major issues at the ballot box.

So on this Now or Never, we're meeting people who are taking desperate and creative measures to find a home.

A former refugee in Winnipeg who is dedicated to finding housing for newcomers... with a two-week ticking clock.

A group of friends who've decided that co-owning is their only way to crack the Toronto housing market, even if they haven't quite figured out the logistics of cohabitating with friends.

A woman in Tuktoyaktuk fights to save her home from sliding into the Beaufort Sea.

A Winnipeg man who spent 5 years living on the streets tells us what it's taken for him to finally get a room of his own.

A university student fights back against the tough B.C. housing market by living his truck.

Why a young Vancouver family quit their jobs and moved halfway across the country in the name of a more affordable mortgage.
description: Nearly two million people in the country are in housing that is unsafe, overcrowded, or unaffordable. Meet people who are taking desperate - and creative -  measures to find a home.
